intro: Celmisia prorepens, commonly known as the slender celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Celmisia prorepens is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
